Maintenant 2 semaines que j'ai ma Kawette et je suis juste largement 
conquis par cette meule. Honnêtement la ER6n est juste une moto génial que 
sa soit pour les débutants ou pour les plus vieux motards !﻿

Elle est un peu lourde aussi non ? J'ai passé mon permis là-dessus, comme 
beaucoup de monde, et la selle était pas ultra confortable. Sinon par 
rapport à la MT-07 elle est au même prix et a moins de gueule, je trouve.﻿

comments.text:
+TheJusticeCross Je fais 1m90 et 80kilos,et j'ai vraiment eu aucun 
problèmes avec.
Mais pour la MT07 c'est un Bi, etc'est plus chèr que le Bandit que j'vais 
prendre.
J'aime pas les bi-cylindre.

comments.text:
Je fais aussi dans les 70 kg, et c'était tout sauf un vélo, sur le lent 
c'était pas easy easy. Mais je regarde les MT07 en ce moment, moins chères 
et quasi parfaites.

na son seul défaut c'est quel chauffe beaucoup au ralenti pour moi c'est ca

comments.author: guiguidu75018

comments.text:
Malgrès le poids sur la fiche technique, tu la sens pas entre les jambes, 
c'est vif comme un vélo, je fais qu' 1m80 pour 70 kilos 
Le seul point noir de cette moto c'est peut être le pompage des amortos et 
encore on s'y fait vite
quand à la selle c'est sur qu'au bout de deux heure de baroude t'as le cul 
en feu mais pour des petites ballades c'est largement suffisant ! loin 
d'être une planche de bois

j'ai jamais comparé.

top_comment.text:
Bonne vidéo, la moto je dis rien je suis pas encore monté dessus. En 
revanche suis-je le seul à me dire qu'akrapovic se fout de la gueule du 
monde ? 1000€ la ligne basique pour un roadster à 6000€ ???﻿
top_comment.author: TheDidiwolf34

comments.text:
A ok c est bon a savoir lol
Mais sinon j'aime akrapovic pour son gain en couple et chevaux ,mais j ai 
aussi termignoni

comments.text: mon père en a eu deux.. rien à redire
comments.author: TheDidiwolf34

comments.text:
+TheDidiwolf34 Oui je suis d accord mais leo vince n est pas une référence 
en terme de qualité de finition
comments.author: Théo 17420

comments.text:
franchement j'ai du mal à comprendre leur succès quand tu vois le prix 
ahurissant de leurs produits par rapport à des marques comme leo vince ou 
SC project, qui font des pots plus sympas. Par exemple les pots pour BMW 
F800, c'est aussi moche que l'origine, ça fait pas plus de bruit et ça 
coûte 660€ !! Alors qu'un leo vince sbk evo II full cabone qui a une belle 
gueule et qui fait un bruit pas mal coûte moitié moins cher...
comments.author: TheDidiwolf34

comments.text:
Non peut être pas le seul mais moi en tout cas je pense le contraire car 
akrapovic fait vraiment du bon matos.
  C'est vraiment de la qualité tant pour les matériaux utilisés que la 
finition ou même la sonorité.
comments.author: Théo 17420

captions.text: Here, at this moment, I already know what’s up in your mind
Pfouah, an ER6 ! This video is going to be boring
Yeah sure 72 horsepower and a moto-school look, we’ve seen sexier
Certainly, it even smells monotony actually
In its defense, you have to know that this little kawa has several personalities.
Do you mean it suffers from schizophrenia ?
Haha! Your Moto is schizo
Ok well, to get simple, let’s say it has many faces
Speaking of which, I’ll let you judge by yourself.
We could have started with this
Because first, an ER6, it is made for easy riding
Get to your workplace
or even to obtain your driving license
But that, we were all aware of
What we know less
it’s that when putting a guy
like Matt Mekatricks
behind the handlebar of this little roadster
well here it goes…
Who said that in order to stunt
or drift
you need a lot of power?
What you really need is a big fat dose of talent
No oversized rear sprocket
pff how dumb
no rear brake shifted to the handle
or extended swingarm
Apart from the Akrapovic line
our ER6 is full stock
And it is clear that in its simpler apparel
the little Kawasaki already allows to achieve many tricks
To do this kind of stunts
the ER6 can count on a punchy engine
an efficient brake system
adjustable levers
and a quite soft fork assisting stoppies
On the other hand
the rather long transmission needs some skills for the wheelings
Also, the short wheelbase
or the floppy shock absorber
won’t facilitate the drifts
Nonetheless, when looking at Matt
we could think that all it needs is to put 4kg of pressure in the rear tire
and the deed is done
Wow nice stunts!
So how good is the ER6 ?
Well listen this bike is quite surprising
a bit soft in suspensions
but a nice engine, it lifts well, it slides...
a good bike to begin with in my opinion
Ugh ! It is not this way beginners start motorcycle!
You insane
you thug
Youth !
Woah you’re weird man
you’re not alone in your head ?
After ripping back our ER6 from the hands of this reckless dude
it was time to get back on the right way
In a more usual way
the little Kawa roadster quickly reveals its charms
We appreciate this natural riding position
slightly leaning forward
but not too much
We appreciate the evident handling aswell
the bike’s agility
the softness of the controls
the gearbox locking well
or the easy dosing brake
As for the seat
first, you are at ease
rather comfortable
But after some time, a slight buttocks pain shows up
Peaceful, serene
cradled by the regular beat of the two-cylinder
we swing from one corner to another with peace of mind
Like here at the Settons
where it smells holidays
calmness...
an also boredom a bit I must admit
Hey, it’s not because we’re on a basic roadster
that we always have to ride like an old lady right ?
When it's time to push hard
the ER6 reveals a really nice temper
This one hides above 7000 RPM
point where the vertical twin raises the tone
Under this engine speed
we can find enough softness to throttle without touching too much at the gearbox
Even if a little more smoothness at low speed
would not have displeased us
Higher, we immediately note an increased punch
a more confident temper
And sport sensations
expressed by an Akrapovic line, backfiring at wish
As long as you don’t hustle the bike
the chassis stands the shock
The Kawette even shows an incredible swiftness in angles switching…
and is far more precise and rigorous
than most of its concurrence
Still, some shock pumps
will quickly remind you the bike’s limits
Hey, at 6 000€ the piece
obviously, you can’t have a full Ohlins display
And you have to compose with soft suspensions
designed for the rider’s comfort
What’s wrong with you ?
The road is not a circuit
Well it’s ok then I will go on a track
Oh no, the track, it is my job
come on, move on, move on
Ok, ok go on...
An ER6 on track
they went crazy at Moto Journal
Well not that much!
Against all odds
the small Kawa roadster has impressive sport rankings
First through the ER6 cup
Brand competition today gone
that allowed to compete but for cheap
And made some renowned pilots
like Louis Bulle
or Baptiste Guittet hatching
More recently
we even found the Kawasaki at the Tourist Trophy
in the Lightweight class
On the bike, this year’s winner Dean Harrisson
has buckled up his three laps in 57 minutes and 49 seconds
with an average speed about 190km/h
Here, on the Magny-Cours circuit
no records
Let's say that a dirty track and tires near their deadline
did not allow us to play with the ER6 limits
And that’s a shame !
Since the Kawasaki is the ideal toy to have fun
and progress on track
We refine our brakings
we make up for the low power
by taking good care of our trajectories
and moreover, above everything
we throttle like hell exiting corners
to pull every horsepower out of the parallel twin
It’s nice actually
as there’s not much horsepower
you learn how to go fast in corners and…
No! The ER6 is not made to learn how to race
it is made to learn how to drive slowly
What?! Mind your own business
Yeah what are you talking you fool
the track guy’s right, it’s done to go full throttle
Well no, I do not agree
Woah!
Where are all those guys coming from ?
They’re all like me !
Well in less skilled of course
On the Kawasaki ER6-N
We liked
The engine’s temper
The suspensions homogeneity
The braking quality
The bargain price
The proven face of the ER6
We disliked
The lack of engine smoothness at low speed
The hard saddle in long runs

title: Essai Kawasaki ER6-n : La moto schizophrène (English Subtitles)
